Utility Modules#

This section covers the utility modules in AutoClean.

Configuration#

autoclean.utils.config.load_config(config_file: Path) → dict[source]#
autoclean.utils.config.validate_pylossless_config(autoclean_dict: dict, task: str, config_file_path: Path) → None[source]#

Validate and locate the pylossless configuration file for a given task.

This function checks if the pylossless configuration file exists at the specified path. If not found at the absolute path, it attempts to find it relative to the main config file directory. Updates the config dictionary with the full path if found.

Args:

autoclean_dict: Configuration dictionary containing task settings task: Name of the current processing task config_file_path: Path to the main configuration file

Returns:

dict: Updated configuration dictionary

Example:
>>> validate_pylossless_config(
...     autoclean_dict={"tasks": {"rest": {"lossless_config": "lossless.yaml"}}},
...     task="rest",
...     config_file_path=Path("/path/to/config.yaml")
... )
autoclean.utils.config.validate_signal_processing_params(autoclean_dict: dict, task: str) → None[source]#

Validate signal processing parameters for physical constraints. Args:

autoclean_dict: Configuration dictionary task: Current processing task

Raises:

ValueError: If parameters violate signal processing constraints

autoclean.utils.config.validate_eeg_system(autoclean_dict: dict, task: str) → str[source]#
autoclean.utils.config.hash_and_encode_yaml(content, is_file=True)[source]#
autoclean.utils.config.decode_compressed_yaml(encoded_str)[source]#

Database#

Database utilities for the autoclean package using UnQLite.

autoclean.utils.database.set_database_path(path: Path) → None[source]#

Set the global database path.

Args:

path: Path to the database directory

exception autoclean.utils.database.DatabaseError(message)[source]#

Bases: Exception

Custom exception for database operations.

exception autoclean.utils.database.RecordNotFoundError(message)[source]#

Bases: Exception

Custom exception for when a database record is not found.

autoclean.utils.database.get_run_record(run_id: str) → dict[source]#

Get a run record from the database by run ID.

Args:

run_id: String ID of the run to retrieve autoclean_dir: Path to the autoclean output directory

Returns:

dict: The run record if found, None if not found

autoclean.utils.database.manage_database(operation: str, run_record: Dict[str, Any] | None = None, update_record: Dict[str, Any] | None = None) → Any[source]#

Manage database operations with thread safety.

Args:

operation: Type of operation (‘create_collection’, ‘store’, ‘update’, etc.) run_record: Record to store (for ‘store’ operation) update_record: Record updates (for ‘update’ operation)

File System#

autoclean.utils.file_system.step_prepare_directories(task: str, autoclean_dir_str: Path) → tuple[Path, Path, Path, Path, Path, Path, Path, Path][source]#

Set up and validate directory structure for processing pipeline.

Args:

task: Name of the processing task autoclean_dir_str: Path to the autoclean directory

Returns:

Tuple of Path objects for key directories: (autoclean_dir, bids_dir, metadata_dir, clean_dir, stage_dir, debug_dir, script_dir)

Raises:

EnvironmentError: If AUTOCLEAN_DIR is not set or invalid PermissionError: If unable to create/access required directories

Logging#

Logging utilities for the autoclean package.

class autoclean.utils.logging.WarningToLogger[source]#

Bases: object

class autoclean.utils.logging.LogLevel(value)[source]#

Bases: str, Enum

Enum for log levels matching MNE’s logging levels.

These levels correspond to Python’s standard logging levels: - DEBUG = 10 - INFO = 20 - WARNING = 30 - ERROR = 40 - CRITICAL = 50

Plus custom levels: - VALUES = 5 - HEADER = 25

VALUES = 'VALUES'#
DEBUG = 'DEBUG'#
HEADER = 'HEADER'#
INFO = 'INFO'#
SUCCESS = 'SUCCESS'#
WARNING = 'WARNING'#
ERROR = 'ERROR'#
CRITICAL = 'CRITICAL'#
classmethod from_value(value: str | int | bool | None) → LogLevel[source]#

Convert various input types to LogLevel.

Args:
value: Input value that can be:

  • str: One of DEBUG, INFO, WARNING, ERROR, or CRITICAL

  • int: Standard Python logging level (10, 20, 30, 40, 50)

  • bool: True for INFO, False for WARNING

  • None: Use MNE_LOGGING_LEVEL env var or default to INFO

Returns:

LogLevel: The corresponding log level

class autoclean.utils.logging.MessageType(value)[source]#

Bases: str, Enum

Enum for message types with their corresponding log levels and symbols.

HEADER = 'header'#
ERROR = 'error'#
WARNING = 'warning'#
INFO = 'info'#
VALUES = 'values'#
DEBUG = 'debug'#
autoclean.utils.logging.message(level: str, text: str, **kwargs) → None[source]#

Enhanced logging function with support for lazy evaluation and context.

Args:

level: Log level (‘debug’, ‘info’, ‘warning’, etc.) text: Message text to log **kwargs: Additional context variables for formatting

autoclean.utils.logging.configure_logger(verbose: bool | str | int | LogLevel | None = None, output_dir: str | Path | None = None, task: str | None = None) → None[source]#

Configure the logger based on verbosity level and output directory.

Args:
verbose: Controls logging verbosity. Can be:

  • bool: True is the same as ‘INFO’, False is the same as ‘WARNING’

  • str: One of ‘DEBUG’, ‘INFO’, ‘WARNING’, ‘ERROR’, or ‘CRITICAL’

  • int: Standard Python logging level (10=DEBUG, 20=INFO, etc.)

  • LogLevel enum: Direct log level specification

  • None: Reads MNE_LOGGING_LEVEL environment variable, defaults to INFO

output_dir: Directory where task outputs will be stored task: Name of the current task. If provided, logs will be stored in task’s debug directory

BIDS Utilities#

autoclean.utils.bids.step_convert_to_bids(raw, output_dir, task='rest', participant_id=None, line_freq=60.0, overwrite=False, events=None, event_id=None, study_name='EEG Study')[source]#

Converts a single EEG data file into BIDS format with default/dummy metadata.

Parameters: - file_path (str or Path): Path to the EEG data file. - output_dir (str or Path): Directory where the BIDS dataset will be created. - task (str, optional): Task name. Defaults to ‘resting’. - participant_id (str, optional): Participant ID. Defaults to sanitized basename of the file. - line_freq (float, optional): Power line frequency in Hz. Defaults to 60.0. - overwrite (bool, optional): Whether to overwrite existing files. Defaults to False. - study_name (str, optional): Name of the study. Defaults to “EEG Study”.

Dependent Functions: - step_sanitize_id(): Sanitizes and formats participant ID from filename - step_create_dataset_desc(): Creates BIDS dataset description JSON file - step_create_participants_json(): Creates participants.json metadata file - update_sidecar_json(): Updates sidecar JSON files with additional metadata

autoclean.utils.bids.step_sanitize_id(filename)[source]#

Sanitizes the participant ID extracted from the filename to comply with BIDS conventions.

Parameters: - filename (str): The filename to sanitize.

Returns: - str: A sanitized participant ID.

autoclean.utils.bids.step_create_dataset_desc(output_path, study_name)[source]#

Creates BIDS dataset description JSON file.

Parameters: - output_path (Path): Directory where the file will be created - study_name (str): Name of the study

autoclean.utils.bids.step_create_participants_json(output_path)[source]#

Creates participants.json metadata file.

Parameters: - output_path (Path): Directory where the file will be created
